Description: Along with the minor chord, it isone of the basic building blocks of tonal music in Western music. In it's most basic form, it is also known as a Major Triad.
Sound: Happy, Consonant, stable, not requiring resolution

Description: The Major 7th is a half step below the root note. A common use case for this chord is to give the tonic chord in a major scale a slight dissonant edge.  It is often used in traditional pop, jazz, bossa nova, indie etc

The Major 9th is also the 2nd of the root note, it is written as 9 because it is a chord extension. The Major 9th chord is often used to provide more texture and variety to your playing. In a thick chord like this, the 5th can also be left out and it will still sound great. Used in blues, jazz etc
Sound: More dissonant than 7th chords, jazzy, soft, chill

Description: Along with the major chord, it is one of the basic building blocks of tonal music in Western music. In it's most basic form, it is also known as a Minor Triad
Sound: Sad/Dark, Consonant, stable, not requiring resolution
